stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Authorisation Letter Themed Phishing Email Targets Government Department Employees
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 30 October 2014, a U.S. government department reported that two email accounts were targeted using emails with the subject line "Authorisation Letter". The emails were sent from r.ismail@alerthr.com and carried a malicious attachment "Scan-141027-0004.doc". The malicious attachment contained shellcode for an RTF related exploit, and code to download a malicious file. The download attempts were via HTTP to destination TCP port 80, to a hardcoded URL: http:///189.226.87.150/~soaresem/.sql/skelewu.exe

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
----- BEGIN EMAIL HEADER ----- Subject: AUTHORISATION LETTER From: ismail <r.ismail@alerthr.com>; To: [REDACTED]; Date: Thu Oct 30 04:21:23 GMT 2014 Received: from localhost (localhost [127.0.0.1])by mail.rsup-perkebunan.co.id (Postfix) with ESMTP id [REDACTED]; Thu, 30 Oct 2014 11:14:03 +0000 (UTC) X-Virus-Scanned: amavisd-new at rsup-perkebunan.co.id Received: from mail.rsup-perkebunan.co.id ([127.0.0.1])by localhost (mail.rsup-perkebunan.co.id [127.0.0.1]) (amavisd-new, port 10024)with ESMTP id EHXUQVovsmrc for [REDACTED];Thu, 30 Oct 2014 11:14:03 +0000 (UTC) Received: from salesadmin (182.Red-80-24-205.staticIP.rima-tde.net [80.24.205.182])by mail.rsup-perkebunan.co.id (Postfix) with ESMTPA id 2C2BA1807D0for [REDACTED]; Thu, 30 Oct 2014 11:13:51 +0000 (UTC) Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="2YRJkEFU3K=_erafoovuK8c4dckiKfhLGU0" MIME-Version: 1.0 Message-Id: <20141030111352.2C2BA1807D0@mail.rsup-perkebunan.co.id> Attachments: Scan-141027-0004.doc (40896 bytes); ----- END EMAIL HEADER -----
----- BEGIN EMAIL BODY----- Hello,
Please find attached authorization letter for your reference. Kind regards, Ismail ----- END EMAIL BODY-----

This is a trojanized Rich Text File (RTF) with a .doc file extension and default language settings for Russian (Cyrillic) that is opened by MS Word. When opened, the file runs an ActiveX OCX and Shellcode ROP exploit (see NIST CVE-2012-0158). No additional files are installed by this RTF.
Instead, the RTF contains a file downloader; which will retrieve a file from the hardcoded IP address 189.226.87.150 by performing an HTTP (destination) port 80 GET request for the file "/~soaresem/.sql/skelewu.exe". Once downloaded, skelewu.exe is renamed and moved to the file system.exe in the user's temp directory and launched.
If the RTF exploit is successful, a file is retrieved from the hardcoded IP address 189.226.87.150 by performing an HTTP (destination) port 80 GET request for the file "/~soaresem/.sql/skelewu.exe".
